Julius Nepos, the current de jure Emperor of the Western Roman Empire, has been murdered by members of his own military in Dalmatia. Some say the murder was ordered by Odoacer, head of the Germanic Foederati in Italy and de facto ruler of the Italian peninsula since 476 AD.

With the death of Julius Nepos, the last serious legal claim to the Western Roman Empire belongs now to the ruling Syagrii dynasty of Soissons.

Before aspiring to reclaim the imperial title, however, the Roman rulers in northern Gaul will have to deal with the increasingly hostile warbands of the Franks, seeking to expand their control to the west.

After the collapse of the Roman Empire, the legion was abandoned to his faith with no orders or supplies.\n\nUpon the death of their former commander, the soldiers decided to march to Lutetia and swear fealty to [From.GetTitledName], considering [From.GetHerHim] as the most legitimate Roman ruler in the region.
They are most welcome! Long live the Empire!

The Legio VI Gallicana is at your command. It is a standing army of 1500 men and will rapidly reinforce troops lost in battle. However, in the event of the annihilation of the legion, they cannot be raised again unless you conquer the legionary base of §YBeda§!.
Those soldiers are a fearsome force...

The current commander of the Legio VI Gallicana, [Root.GetTitledFirstName], with no legitimate Roman ruler left in the region, has decided to reform his ranks and convert the former vassal legion into an independent mercenary company.\n\nFrom now on, these highly-trained and fearsome warriors will fight exclusively for gold and glory. They are currently stationed in Lutetia and searching for wealthy rulers to fight for.
You are the current ruler of the restored northern Roman Empire in Gaul. May your reign be a prosperous one!
You are the current ruler of the restored northern Roman Empire in Britannia. May your reign be a prosperous one!
You are no longer the ruler of the restored northern Roman Empire in Gaul. It will surely crumble without your guiding hand to lead it.
You are no longer the ruler of the restored northern Roman Empire in Britannia. It will surely crumble without your guiding hand to lead it.

He speaks of the uncertain situation and the many threats to the realm, from the barbarian kingdoms of the Franks and Visigoths to the Saxon pirates roaming the seas, and insists that we contribute more to the defense of the realm - essentially demanding that we submit to central rule from [From.Capital.GetName]. If we do not, the emissary suggests there will be war...
For the good of the realm, then.
Fight for your independence along with the other rebelling tributaries.
Your emissary has returned from the court of [From.GetTitledName] bearing good news. It seems that [From.GetSheHe] has agreed to your demands and submitted to your direct rule.
[From.GetTitledName] has responded to your demands with derision and has flat out refused to submit to you, instead mobilizing [From.GetHerHis] forces for war.

The people in [Root.Location.GetName], or, at least, most of them, have embraced the [Root.Culture.GetName] culture and are becoming properly Roman!
My hard work has paid off!

Under the rule of Augustus [From.GetTitledName], the Romans have successfully reconquered all the lands and provinces of Gaul, defeating the various Germanic tribes that sought to make the region their new home.\n\nThe victorious legions can now turn their attention north, to the lost shores of Britannia. As the legitimate ruler of the Romans, [From.GetTitledName] has earned the right to sail across the Mare Britannicum to reclaim imperial sovereignty over the British Isles.

Under the rule of Augustus [From.GetTitledName], the Romans have successfully reconquered all the lands and provinces of Gaul, defeating the various Germanic tribes that sought to make the region their new home.\n\nThe victorious legions can now turn their attention back further north and west, to the shores of the Irish and Picts that so ravaged Britannia. As the legitimate ruler of the Romans, [From.GetTitledName] has earned the right to push beyond Hadrian's Wall and sail across the Mare Hibernicum to conquer the unruly barbarians beyond.
We will reconquer Britannia! Long live the Empire!
Caledonia and Hibernia await! Long live the Empire!

Under the rule of Augustus [From.GetTitledName], the Romans have successfully reconquered all the lands and provinces of Britannia for the first time since the Britons so rashly expelled the Roman magistrates in 409.\n\nAs a sense of normalcy settles on the war-torn province once more, the victorious legions can now turn their attention further north and west, to the shores of the Irish and Picts that so ravaged the province. As the legitimate ruler of the Romans, [From.GetTitledName] has earned the right to push beyond Hadrian's Wall and sail across the Mare Hibernicum to conquer the unruly barbarians beyond.

Under the rule of Augustus [From.GetTitledName], the Romans have successfully restored imperial rule to all the lands and provinces of Britannia for the first time since the Britons so rashly expelled the Roman magistrates in 409.\n\nAs a sense of normalcy settles on the war-torn province once more, the victorious legions can now turn their attention to the south, to the battered shores of Gaul. As the legitimate ruler of the Romans, [From.GetTitledName] has earned the right to sail across the Mare Britannicum to reclaim imperial sovereignty over Gaul.
Long live the Empire! Caledonia and Hibernia await!
We will reconquer Gaul! Long live the Empire!

Under the rule of Augustus [From.GetTitledName], the Romans have crossed Hadrian's Wall and successfully conquered all the lands and provinces of Valentia and Caledonia in the far north of Britannia. \n\nVictorius where Agricola and Septimus Severus ultimately failed, the unruly Pictish and Gaelic tribes of Caledonia have been finally brought under Roman rule and civilization for the first time. As the victorius legions triumph, the people of Britannia can rest easily once more knowing that never again will the Gaels and Picts rise up to ravage the province one more.

Under the rule of Augustus [From.GetTitledName], the Romans have crossed the Mare Hibernicum and successfully conquered all the lands and provinces of Hibernia never before under Roman rule. 

While not the first time Roman expeditions have landed in the tribal lands of Hibernia, the establishment of permanent Roman rule in earnest brings the fertile isle under the rule of order and civilization for the first time. The people of western Britannia can now rest easily once more, finally safe from the Irish raiders and settlers that so ravaged the province in its times of chaos. 

Perhaps an ambitious and wealthy emperor could use the fierce warriors of the Irish to create a new legion...

Abandoned to its fate in the imperial crises of the 3rd century, the territories of the Agri Decumates has long fallen to Alemannic rule. Little remains of the Roman towns and forts that once dotted the region, the only part of Germania Magna to come under Roman rule.\n\nWith the revival of Roman power in Gaul, interest has grown within the restored empire of recovering the region and restoring the borders of the old Upper Germanic Limes. To this end, the imperial Senate has officially granted permission for [Root.GetTitledName] to begin military campaigns for the subjugation of the area and the restoration of the old civitates and Imperial administrative structure in the region.
The borders of the empire must be restored!

The humiliating defeat of Quinctilius Varus in the Battle of the Teutoburg Forest crushed the dream of Roman expansion into Magna Germania. Apart from the Agri Decumates in the south, the Romans would never again make a serious attempt to conquer east of the Rhine.\n\nBut now, emboldened by the successful reconquest of the Agri Decumates, [Root.GetTitledName] has declared [Root.GetHerHis] intention to revive Augustus's dream of an empire stretching to the Albis river and the beginning of a campaign to subjugate all of Germania Magna under Roman rule. Henceforth, the Senate has granted permission for the Imperator to permanently extend the empire's control and territory beyond the Germanic Limes, and organize new civitates and provinces in the annexed provinces.
The Eagle marches into Germania once more!
We defeated them once. We will do so again!

Under the rule of Augustus [From.GetTitledName], the Romans have crossed the Rhenus river and successfully reconquered all of the lands of the Agri Decumates for the first time since its abandonment in the 3rd century. \n\nThe reconquest of the region creates a buffer zone between the cities of Imperial Gaul and the free Germanic tribes beyond, as soldiers rebuild and reman the long-abandoned forts of the old Upper Germanic Limes and Roman settlers flood into the newly refounded colonies. Even as a great triumph is held for the victorious legions, the ambitious Romans look still beyond to the unconquered lands of Germania Libera...
Long live the Empire! Germania awaits!

Under the rule of Augustus [From.GetTitledName], the Romans have done what was once thought impossible and successfully conquered all the lands and provinces of Germania, extending the frontier to the Albis river. \n\nThe defeat of Publius Quinctilius Varus by the Germanic king Arminius fully avenged, the Roman aquila now flies high above the many forts and towns that now dot the region, bringing true Roman civilization to the region for the first time. The people of Gaul can now rest easily once more, safe in the knowledge that the fierce Germanic tribes that so many times plundered their cities will never again be a threat to the empire.

Under the rule of [Root.GetTitledName], the Romans have conquered further into Jutland and formed the 'Civitas of Cimbria' in the lightly forested lands that formed the northeastern tip of the penninsula. \n\nFrom this day on, the provinces in all or parts of the areas formerly claimed by the petty kingdoms of Waindilaland and northern Sugjalanda will belong 'de jure' to the newly formed civitas. Any previous claim or birthright will no longer be recognized, and the new Roman rulers will be considered the only rightful owners of these lands.

Under the rule of [Root.GetTitledName], the Romans have conquered further into Jutland and formed the 'Civitas of Charudia' from the lands that lay between the Skjern River to the south, and the Stor and Gudena Rivers to the north. \n\nFrom this day on, the provinces in all or parts of the areas formerly claimed by the petty kingdoms of Jalinglanda, Sugjalanda,  and southern Hurthalanda will belong 'de jure' to the newly formed civitas. Any previous claim or birthright will no longer be recognized, and the new Roman rulers will be considered the only rightful owners of these lands.

Under the rule of [Root.GetTitledName], the Romans have conquered further into Jutland and formed the 'Civitas of Reudingia' by combining the great plains of Gurthaheimar with the fertile farmlands of the petty kingdom of Fyjon.\n\nFrom this day on, the provinces in these two lands claimed by local Germanic tribes will belong 'de jure' to the newly formed civitas. Any previous claim or birthright will no longer be recognized, and the new Roman rulers will be considered the only rightful owners of these lands.

Under the rule of [Root.GetTitledName], the Romans have conquered further into Jutland and formed the 'Civitas of Anglia' from the lands that once were inhabited by the native Angles, and later by Norse invaders. \n\nFrom this day on, the provinces in the areas formerly refered to as Mofdingas and Myrgingas by local Germanic tribes will belong 'de jure' to the newly formed civitas. Any previous claim or birthright will no longer be recognized, and the new Roman rulers will be considered the only rightful owners of these lands.

Under the rule of [Root.GetTitledName], the Romans have crossed the Elbe River into Jutland and formed the 'Citivas of Saxonia' in the the last vestige of the Germanic Kingdom of Saxony--the plains of Northalbingia.\n\nFrom this day on, the provinces in the areas stretching from the Elbe in the south and the Egdor River in the north will belong 'de jure' to the newly formed civitas. Any previous claim or birthright will no longer be recognized, and the new Roman rulers will be considered the only rightful owners of these lands.

Under the rule of [Root.GetTitledName], the Romans have conquered further into Jutland and formed the 'Civitas of Teutonia' in the combined plains, inlets, and large islands that formed the northwestern portion of the penninsula. \n\nFrom this day on, the provinces of the areas formerly claimed by the entirety of the petty kingdom of Saiwidanilanda and parts of northern Hurthalanda will belong 'de jure' to the newly formed civitas. Any previous claim or birthright will no longer be recognized, and the new Roman rulers will be considered the only rightful owners of these lands.

For generations, it was thought that the Roman appetite for expansion was finally sated in Germania, with the heavily guarded frontier of the Albis River protecting Romans from Norse tribal rulers and raiders.  But under the rule of Augustus [From.GetTitledName], the Romans have done what was once thought impossible and successfully conquered all the lands and provinces of Jutland. \n\nWith the penninsula fully under Roman rule, and towns and forts dotting the landscape where once was only pasture and tribal holdings, the light of Roman civilization shines from tip to tip of the Gallic coast. As such, no longer will the province be recognized as the land of the Jutes, but forevermore be known as the Roman Province of Cimbria!
How could we be defeated so easily?

Under the rule of Augustus [From.GetTitledName] the Romans have successfully reconquered all the largest cities and the most important strategic holdings of central Britain.

To celebrate these victories and as a statement of Roman sovereignty over the british isles, [From.GetTitledName] proclaimed an official edict to fully restore 'Ius Imperii' in Britannia.

From this day on, all lands south of Antonine's Wall will once again belong 'de jure' to the Imperium Romanum.

For the first time in history, the Roman legions have successfully conquered vast lands in the once remote island of Hibernia.

To celebrate these victories and as a statement of Roman sovereignty, it has been proclaimed that from this day on the island will be considered 'de jure' as a Consular Province of the Imperium Romanum. Its lands will be divided among the two provinces of Hibernia Prima and Hibernia Secunda.

Any previous claim or birthright from the former Irish and Gaelic rulers will no longer be recognized by the Roman authorities.

Having successfully reconquered vast lands from the neighbouring kingdoms in northern Gaul, the Roman King of Soissons, [Root.GetFirstName], has proclaimed himself 'Augustus Imperator Galliarum' and issued an official edict restoring Roman Imperial Law and the old provincial system over the reconquered lands.

With the tacit support of the Eastern Roman Emperor in Costantinople, [Root.GetFirstName] has been formally recognized as the undisputed ruler of the Romans in Gaul and in the British Isles.

The mightiest empire the civilised world has ever seen is rising once again in the North. Will the Romans reclaim their ancient sovereignty over Britannia?
The legacy of Rome will never fade away!
The Romans never conquered Ireland. And they never will!
Britain does not belong to Romans, but to the Anglo-Saxons!

Having successfully restored vast parts of Britannia under Roman rule, the Roman governor [Root.GetFirstName] has proclaimed himself 'Augustus Imperator Britannicum' and issued an official edict restoring Roman Imperial Law over the reconquered lands.

With the tacit support of the Eastern Roman Emperor in Costantinople, [Root.GetFirstName] has been formally recognized as the undisputed ruler of the Romans in Gaul and in the British Isles.

The mightiest empire the civilised world has ever seen is rising once again in the North. Will the Romans be able to defeat the barbarian hordes and restore their ancient sovereignty over Gaul?
The legacy of Rome will never fade away!
The Romans never conquered Ireland. And they never will!
Gaul does not belong to Romans, but to the Franks!
The Fall of Romans in Gaul

After the fall of the Domain of Soissons, the last of legitimate Roman rulers in northern Gaul has been deprived of land and titles. With this final demise, the once undisputed Roman imperial sovereignty in the West has apparently come to an unrecoverable close.\n\nThe mightiest empire the civilised world has ever seen is broken, and although its authority endures in Constantinople and in the eastern provinces, the people of the British Isles can consider themselves free from the shadow of Roman oppression once and for all.

After the fall of the Domain of Soissons, the last of legitimate Roman rulers in northern Gaul has been deprived of land and titles. With this demise, the only remaining Roman authorities in all of the west are those still clinging on in the former imperial province of Britannia.\n\nThe mightiest empire the civilised world has ever seen is broken, and although its authority endures in Constantinople and in the eastern provinces, will the remaining Romans of Britannia be able to defeat the barbarian hordes and restore Roman rule over the west once more?.
This is unacceptable! Rome will never fall!

After a series of defeats, the Roman usurper of Gaul has been defeated by the true Augustus of the west. Will this signal an increase in Roman authority over Gaul and Britannia, or is it merely a single victory in what will continue to be the utter destruction of the Roman Empire in the west?
Another nail in the coffin of the Roman Empire...

Upset at what they consider to be neglect from the imperial capital, the legions of Gaul have promoted a local ruler to the rank of Augustus, in defiance of the emperor in Rome. This is a harsh blow to Roman authority in the region. If the Emperor in Rome is strong enough, he will be able to summon enough legions to put down this revolt, but if not, we may see a transition of rule. An emperor with symapthies towards the British and Gallic provinces could be a good thing for us.

In an attempt to reverse the ever diminishing Roman authority over Gaul and the rest of the Western Empire, the legions of Gallia have hailed you as the rightful Imperator of the Western Empire, and you have recieved the support of several of the regional governors. There will however be a strong resistance to your cause from Rome itself, and the false Augustus who resides in the capital will no doubt be in a hurry to see your demise.

Overwhelmed by the legions of Italia, your support from the local governors has quickly disappeared. Utterly defeated by the Emperor in Rome, you are now entirely at his mercy. Though this may not be the last rebellion in the area, for now, at least, Roman authority in Gaul has been restored.
I never meant to start a war!
With your defeat, you are no longer recognised as Augustus, and to continue to call yourself as such would be ridiculous.

The Roman army is strong but fickle, with gold being the primary and often the only reliable way of securing their loyalty.
